results.title: We did it!: Victoria
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Keith Gow, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Victoria talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an apprentice chef, an apprentice painter and decorator, an apprentice gardener and a library assistant.
Suitable fvor middle and upper secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Keith Gow, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Film Australia

Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people at work in South Australia, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a fisheries officer, an apprentice diesel mechanic, a nurse, a carpenter and a teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: Rockhampton and Mackay
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Keith Gow, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”
Shows Aboriginal people at work in Rockhampton and Mackay, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an employment officer, a secretary, an apprentice picutre framer and a TAFE field officer.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We can work it out (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Secretary and Her Boss”.
Secretary (Adrienne Posta) and her boss (John Cleese) try to resolve the problems presented in the unsatisfactory manner in which they both handle visitors, telephone calls and dictation.
FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: We can't stand still can we?
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman, ONF | NFB and Ken McCready
results.brief_description: This film is about the urban renewal plan drawn up by the town council of High River, Alberta. It saved the town, and could save many others across Canada.

results.title: We can't afford to be casual about child care (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Milan, Audio Visual Learning Centre, University of Otago and Anne Smith
results.brief_description: Child care is discussed by Dr. Bettye Caldwell from the University of Arkansas and Pat Hubbard, director of the Dunedin community child care centre. They discuss whether child care damages mother-child attachment, the importance of an optimal environment for children in early years, the particular qualities and nature of good child care, and the difficulty in financing it

results.title: We call them killers
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Tom Shandel
results.brief_description: A rare opportunity to observe two killer whales, Haida and Chimo, kept at the time of filming at the Victoria Sealand of the Pacific Aquarium. Far from any show of ferocity, the huge mammals display a sense of fun and rapport with their trainers, especially during their performances for the public. Dr. Paul Spong, noted cetologist, describes his attempts at inter-species communication. Musician Paul Horn captivates Haida with the sounds of his flute.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Tom Shandel

results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: We both want to win
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Karin Altmann, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Shows two young Australians preparing for their clash in the 100-metre and 200-metre backstroke finals at the Brisbane Commonwealth Games in 1982. Their approaches are very different. Georgina Parkes is a member of an elite national swim squad coached by the man who brought the Cincinnati Marlins to the top of the United States club championships. Lisa Forrest is trained at a suburban swimming school. The consequences of these two approaches reveal some of the pressures in top-level competition.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
